intro: Lobelia urens var. integra, commonly known as the common blueweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems that are often hairy. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, ditches, and along stream banks.
